name: microsoft-intune
label: Microsoft Intune
description: Microsoft Intune provides mobile device management, mobile application management, and PC management capabilities from the cloud.

fields.title: Get Access Token
options: On behalf of User - Delegated Permission
fields.name: auth_type
fields.description: Select the method using which you will get authentication tokens used to access the Intune APIs. You can choose between On behalf of User – Delegate Permission or Without a User - Application Permission. For more information, see the Getting Access Tokens section.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Server URL
Without a User - Application Permission.name: resource
Without a User - Application Permission.description: The service-based URL to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
Without a User - Application Permission.tooltip: The service-based URL to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Directory (tenant) ID
Without a User - Application Permission.name: tenant_id
Without a User - Application Permission.description: ID of the tenant that you have been provided for your Azure Active Directory instance.
Without a User - Application Permission.tooltip: ID of the tenant that you have been provided for your Azure Active Directory instance.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Application (client) ID
Without a User - Application Permission.name: client_id
Without a User - Application Permission.description: Unique ID of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.
Without a User - Application Permission.tooltip: Unique ID of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Application (Client) Secret
Without a User - Application Permission.name: client_secret
Without a User - Application Permission.description: Unique Client Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp.
Without a User - Application Permission.tooltip: Unique Client Secret of the Azure Network Security Group application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp.

On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.title: Server URL
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.name: resource
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.description: The service-based URL to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.tooltip: The service-based URL to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.title: Directory (tenant) ID
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.name: tenant_id
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.description: ID of the tenant that you have been provided for your Azure Active Directory instance.
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.tooltip: ID of the tenant that you have been provided for your Azure Active Directory instance.

On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.title: Application (client) ID
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.name: client_id
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.description: Unique ID of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.tooltip: Unique ID of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.title: Application (Client) Secret
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.name: client_secret
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.description: Unique Client Secret of the Azure Network Security Group application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp.
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.tooltip: Unique Client Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp.

On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.title: Authorization Code
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.name: code
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.tooltip: (Only Applicable to On behalf of User – Delegate Permission) The authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step. For more information, see the Getting Access Tokens using the On behalf of the user – Delegate Permission method section.
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.description: (Only Applicable to On behalf of User – Delegate Permission) The authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step. For more information, see the Getting Access Tokens using the On behalf of the user – Delegate Permission method section.

On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.title: Redirect URI
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.name: redirect_uri
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.tooltip: (Only Applicable to On behalf of User – Delegate Permission) The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. The redirect URL that you specify here must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you have registered in your app registration portal.
On behalf of User - Delegated Permission.description: (Only Applicable to On behalf of User – Delegate Permission) The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. The redirect URL that you specify here must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you have registered in your app registration portal.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get All Location List
operations.description: Retrieves the list of locations from Microsoft Intune.

operations.title: Get Location Details
operations.description: Retrieves specific information for a specific location for an hostname from Microsoft Intune.

operations.title: Get Manageable Apps
operations.description: Retrieves the list of manageable apps from Microsoft Intune based on the hostname and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Hostname
parameters.name: hostName
parameters.description: Specify the hostname for which you want to retrieve the manageable apps from Microsoft Intune.

parameters.title: Search Query
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) The OData's Filter Query using which you want to filter manageable apps to be retrieved from Microsoft Intune. Refer link for more info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/odata/concepts/queryoptions-overview#filter
parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: (Optional) The OData's Filter Query using which you want to filter manageable apps to be retrieved from Microsoft Intune. Refer link for more info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/odata/concepts/queryoptions-overview#filter

parameters.title: Select By
parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the select query to retrieve specific fields from Microsoft Intune. Refer link for more info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/odata/concepts/queryoptions-overview#select
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the select query to retrieve specific fields from Microsoft Intune. Refer link for more info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/odata/concepts/queryoptions-overview#select

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of results this operation should return, per page, in the response.
parameters.name: $top
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of results this operation should return, per page, in the response.

operations.title: Create Android Policy
operations.description: Creates a android policy in Microsoft Intune based on the hostname, policy name, friendly name and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Hostname
parameters.name: hostName
parameters.description: Specify the hostname based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune.

parameters.title: Policy Name
parameters.name: policyName
parameters.description: Specify the name of the policy based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune.

parameters.title: Friendly Name
parameters.name: friendlyName
parameters.description: Specify the name of the friendly based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune.

parameters.title: Location
parameters.name: location
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the location based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune.

parameters.title: Tag
parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the tag based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the description based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune.

parameters.title: Access Recheck Offline Timeout
parameters.name: accessRecheckOfflineTimeout
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the access recheck offline timeout based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune.

parameters.title: Access Recheck Online Timeout
parameters.name: accessRecheckOnlineTimeout
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the access recheck offline timeout based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune.

parameters.title: App Sharing From Level
parameters.name: appSharingFromLevel
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose from the following options: None, Policy Managed Apps, or All Apps.

parameters.title: App Sharing To Level
parameters.name: appSharingToLevel
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose from the following options: None, Policy Managed Apps, or All Apps.

parameters.title: Authentication
parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose either 'Required' or 'Not Required'.

parameters.title: ClipBoard Sharing Level
parameters.name: clipboardSharingLevel
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose from the following options: Blocked, Policy Managed Apps, Policy Managed Apps With PasteIn, or All Apps.

parameters.title: Data Backup
parameters.name: dataBackup
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose either 'Allow' or 'Block'.

parameters.title: Device Compliance
parameters.name: deviceCompliance
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose either 'Allow' or 'Block'.

parameters.title: File Encryption
parameters.name: fileEncryption
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose either 'Required' or 'Not Required'.

parameters.title: File Sharing SaveAs
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose either "Allow" or "Block".
parameters.name: fileSharingSaveAs
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose either "Allow" or "Block".

parameters.title: Managed Browser
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose either "Required" or "Not Required".
parameters.name: managedBrowser
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose either "Required" or "Not Required".

parameters.title: Offline Wipe Timeout
parameters.name: offlineWipeTimeout
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the offline wipe timeout based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune

parameters.title: Pin
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose either "Required" or "Not Required".
parameters.name: pin
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose either "Required" or "Not Required".

parameters.title: Pin Number Retry
parameters.name: pinNumRetry
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of the pin based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune.

parameters.title: Screen Capture
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose either "Allow" or "Block".
parameters.name: screenCapture
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the option based on which you want to create a android policy in Microsoft Intune. You can choose either "Allow" or "Block".
